canonical_explanation.text: Our body needs nutrients from food to grow, get energy, and stay healthy. There are six main nutrients: carbohydrates (energy), proteins (body building), fats (energy and warmth), vitamins (protection from diseases), minerals (body functions), and water (all body processes). A balanced diet contains all these nutrients in the right amounts. Deficiency diseases occur when a nutrient is lacking: scurvy (Vitamin C), rickets (Vitamin D), night blindness (Vitamin A), anaemia (iron), and goitre (iodine). Food can be preserved by refrigeration, drying, pickling, adding sugar or salt, and canning. Good hygiene practices like washing hands before eating, drinking clean water, and keeping food covered help prevent diseases.
rules: Six nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, water
Carbohydrates: energy-giving foods (rice, wheat, potato, sugar)
Proteins: body-building foods (dal, milk, eggs, paneer, meat, fish)
Fats: energy and warmth (ghee, butter, oil, nuts)
Minerals: needed in small amounts (iron, calcium, iodine)
Balanced diet: meal with all nutrients in right amounts
Deficiency diseases: scurvy (Vit C), rickets (Vit D), night blindness (Vit A), anaemia (iron), goitre (iodine)
Food preservation: refrigeration, drying, pickling, canning
Hygiene: wash hands, drink clean water, cover food

questions.question_text: How many main nutrients does our body need?
questions.explanation_correct: Our body needs six main nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. Each nutrient has a specific role in keeping our body healthy and functioning properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is six nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. All six are essential for the body to function properly.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient gives us energy to do our daily activities?
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are the main energy-giving nutrient. Foods rich in carbohydrates include rice, wheat (roti/chapati), potato, bread, and sugar. They give our body the energy to walk, run, study, and do all daily activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamins protect from diseases, minerals help in body functions, and water is needed for all processes. Carbohydrates are specifically the energy-giving nutrients found in foods like rice, roti, and potatoes.

questions.question_text: Proteins are called body-building foods because they help in:

options.text: Growth and repair of the body

questions.explanation_correct: Proteins help in the growth and repair of the body. They build and repair muscles, skin, hair, and other body parts. That is why they are called body-building foods. Children need more proteins because they are growing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy comes mainly from carbohydrates and fats. Protection from cold comes from fats and clothes. Proteins specifically help in building new body cells and repairing damaged ones, which is why they are called body-building foods.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a protein-rich food?
questions.explanation_correct: Dal (lentils) is rich in protein. Other protein-rich foods include milk, paneer, eggs, soybean, fish, and meat. Proteins help in growth and repair of the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, sugar, and potato are rich in carbohydrates, not proteins. Dal is the correct answer because lentils and pulses are excellent sources of protein, especially in the Indian vegetarian diet.

questions.question_text: Fats are found in which of these foods?
questions.explanation_correct: Ghee and butter are rich in fats. Other fat-rich foods include cooking oil, nuts, cheese, and cream. Fats provide energy, keep the body warm, and help absorb some vitamins.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice and wheat are carbohydrate sources. Spinach and cabbage are rich in vitamins and minerals. Water and juice are not fat sources. Ghee and butter are the correct examples of fat-rich foods.

questions.question_text: Vitamins and minerals are called protective foods because they protect us from diseases.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Vitamins and minerals are called protective foods because they help protect our body from diseases and keep our organs working properly. They are found mainly in fruits and vegetables.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Vitamins and minerals play a crucial role in protecting the body from various diseases and infections. They help the body fight germs and keep us healthy.

questions.question_text: Rahul's mother packed his lunch box with rice, dal, sabzi (vegetables), and a banana. Which nutrients does this meal provide?

options.text: Carbohydrates (rice), proteins (dal), vitamins and minerals (sabzi and banana)

questions.explanation_correct: This is a nutritious meal! Rice provides carbohydrates (energy), dal provides proteins (body building), and sabzi and banana provide vitamins and minerals (protection). This is close to a balanced diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This meal is not limited to one nutrient. Each food item contributes different nutrients: rice gives carbohydrates, dal gives proteins, and vegetables and fruits give vitamins and minerals.

questions.question_text: Priya eats only rice and chapati every day, nothing else. What problem might she face?

options.text: She will have too much energy
She will lack proteins, vitamins, and minerals and may become weak and sick

questions.explanation_correct: Eating only rice and chapati means Priya gets only carbohydrates. She will lack proteins (for growth), vitamins and minerals (for protection), and fats. This will make her weak, slow her growth, and make her more likely to fall sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating only rice and chapati does not provide all the nutrients the body needs. Without proteins, vitamins, minerals, and fats, the body cannot grow properly, fight diseases, or function well.

questions.question_text:
Match the nutrient with its main function:
(i) Carbohydrates - (a) Body building
(ii) Proteins - (b) Energy giving
(iii) Vitamins - (c) Protective
Choose the correct match:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct match is: Carbohydrates - Energy giving (b), Proteins - Body building (a), Vitamins - Protective (c). Remember: Carbs for energy, Proteins for building, Vitamins for protection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Remember the functions: Carbohydrates give energy (rice, roti), Proteins build the body (dal, milk), and Vitamins protect from diseases (fruits, vegetables). The correct match is (i)-b, (ii)-a, (iii)-c.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient is needed in the largest quantity by the body?
questions.explanation_correct: Water is needed in the largest quantity. About 70% of our body is water. We need water for digestion, absorption, circulation, and temperature regulation. We should drink at least 6-8 glasses of water daily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While all nutrients are important, water is needed in the largest amount. Our body is about 70% water, and we cannot survive more than a few days without it. Vitamins and minerals are needed in very small amounts.

questions.question_text: A diet that contains all nutrients in the right amounts is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet is one that contains all the essential nutrients - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water - in the right proportions. It keeps our body healthy and provides everything we need to grow and function.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Junk food, fast food, and sweets do not provide all nutrients in the right amounts. A balanced diet includes a variety of foods that together provide all six nutrients the body needs.

questions.question_text: Which of the following meals is MOST likely to be a balanced diet?

options.text: Roti, dal, green vegetables, curd, and an orange

questions.explanation_correct: Roti (carbohydrates), dal (proteins), green vegetables (vitamins, minerals, fibre), curd (protein, calcium), and orange (Vitamin C) together make a balanced meal with all major nutrients.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chips and cola, chocolate and ice cream, or only rice do not provide all nutrients. A balanced meal needs variety: roti for energy, dal for protein, vegetables for vitamins, curd for calcium, and fruit for vitamins.

questions.question_text: Why is it important for growing children to eat a balanced diet?

options.text: Because their bodies are growing and need all nutrients for proper development
It is not important for children

questions.explanation_correct: Growing children need a balanced diet because their bodies are rapidly developing. They need carbohydrates for energy to play and study, proteins for growing muscles and organs, and vitamins and minerals for strong bones, good eyesight, and disease protection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A balanced diet is especially important for children because they are growing. Their bodies need all nutrients for proper growth, strong bones, healthy organs, and protection from diseases.

questions.question_text: Sanjay eats a lot of samosas, pakoras, and fried food every day. What health problem might this cause?

options.text: He may become overweight and develop health problems due to too much fat

questions.explanation_correct: Eating too much fried food gives the body excess fat and calories. This can lead to obesity (being overweight), heart problems, and other health issues. A balanced diet with limited fried food is much healthier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating too much fried food is not healthy. It provides excessive fat and calories, which can cause weight gain and various health problems. A balanced diet with all nutrients in the right amounts is essential.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a balanced diet?

options.text: Nutrients are in the right proportions
It includes fruits, vegetables, grains, and proteins

questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet does NOT need to include only expensive foods. Simple, affordable foods like dal, rice, seasonal vegetables, and local fruits can make a perfectly balanced diet. The key is variety and right proportions, not cost.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A balanced diet has all six nutrients in the right proportions and includes various food groups. It does not need to be expensive. Local, seasonal foods like dal-chawal, sabzi, and seasonal fruits provide excellent nutrition at low cost.

questions.question_text: Scurvy is caused by a lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by a lack of Vitamin C. It leads to bleeding gums, weakness, and slow healing of wounds. Foods rich in Vitamin C include amla (Indian gooseberry), oranges, lemons, and guava.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin A deficiency causes night blindness, Vitamin B deficiency causes beriberi, and Vitamin D deficiency causes rickets. Scurvy is specifically caused by Vitamin C deficiency.

questions.question_text: Rickets, a disease that causes weak and bent bones in children, is caused by a deficiency of:
questions.explanation_correct: Rickets is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin D. Vitamin D helps the body absorb calcium for strong bones. Sunlight helps our body make Vitamin D. Milk, eggs, and fish also contain Vitamin D.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin A deficiency causes night blindness, Vitamin C deficiency causes scurvy, and iron deficiency causes anaemia. Rickets is caused by lack of Vitamin D, which is essential for strong bones.

questions.question_text: Night blindness (difficulty seeing in dim light) is caused by a lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Night blindness is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin A. This vitamin is important for good eyesight. Foods rich in Vitamin A include carrots, papaya, mango, spinach, and sweet potato.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin B helps in energy production, Vitamin C prevents scurvy, and iron prevents anaemia. Vitamin A is specifically needed for good eyesight, and its deficiency leads to night blindness.

questions.question_text: Anaemia, a condition where the blood has too few red blood cells, is caused by a lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Anaemia is caused by a deficiency of iron. Iron is needed to make haemoglobin in red blood cells, which carries oxygen throughout the body. Iron-rich foods include spinach (palak), jaggery (gur), dates, and green leafy vegetables.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Calcium is needed for bones, iodine for the thyroid gland, and Vitamin C prevents scurvy. Iron is the mineral needed to make red blood cells, and its deficiency causes anaemia.

questions.question_text: Goitre, a swelling in the neck, is caused by a lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Goitre is caused by a deficiency of iodine. Iodine is needed by the thyroid gland in the neck. Without enough iodine, the gland swells up. Iodised salt is an easy way to get enough iodine in the diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Iron deficiency causes anaemia, calcium deficiency weakens bones, and Vitamin A deficiency causes night blindness. Goitre is caused by iodine deficiency, which is why we use iodised salt.

questions.question_text: A doctor tells Meena's mother to include more spinach, jaggery, and dates in Meena's diet. Meena most likely has:
questions.explanation_correct: Spinach, jaggery, and dates are all rich in iron. The doctor likely recommends these because Meena has anaemia, which is caused by iron deficiency. Iron is needed to make healthy red blood cells.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spinach, jaggery, and dates are iron-rich foods. For scurvy, citrus fruits would be recommended. For rickets, sunlight and calcium-rich foods. For night blindness, Vitamin A-rich foods like carrots. The iron-rich foods point to anaemia.

questions.question_text: Rajan's grandmother always adds iodised salt to cooking. Why is this important?

options.text: It prevents goitre by providing iodine

questions.explanation_correct: Iodised salt contains iodine, which prevents goitre and other iodine deficiency disorders. The Indian government promotes iodised salt to ensure everyone gets enough iodine in their diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While salt does add taste, the specific reason for using iodised salt is to provide iodine to the body. Iodine deficiency causes goitre (swelling of the thyroid gland in the neck). Using iodised salt is a simple way to prevent this.

questions.question_text:
Match the deficiency disease with the missing nutrient:
(i) Scurvy - (a) Vitamin D
(ii) Rickets - (b) Iron
(iii) Anaemia - (c) Vitamin C
Choose the correct match:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct match is: Scurvy - Vitamin C (c), Rickets - Vitamin D (a), Anaemia - Iron (b). Each disease is caused by the deficiency of a specific nutrient.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Remember: Scurvy = Vitamin C (citrus fruits), Rickets = Vitamin D (sunlight, milk), Anaemia = Iron (spinach, jaggery). The correct matching is (i)-c, (ii)-a, (iii)-b.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin can be obtained from sunlight?
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin D can be made by our body when our skin is exposed to sunlight. This is why Vitamin D is sometimes called the 'sunshine vitamin.' It helps the body absorb calcium for strong bones and teeth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamins A, B, and C must be obtained from food. Vitamin D is unique because our body can produce it when sunlight falls on our skin. That is why playing outdoors in the morning sun is healthy.

questions.question_text: Keeping food in a refrigerator to prevent spoiling is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Refrigeration is the method of preserving food by keeping it cold. Low temperatures slow down the growth of bacteria and fungi that cause food to spoil. This is why we keep milk, vegetables, and cooked food in the fridge.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Drying removes moisture, pickling uses vinegar or brine, and canning seals food in airtight containers. Refrigeration specifically uses cold temperatures to slow down spoilage.

questions.question_text: Making pickles (achar) by adding salt, oil, and spices is a method of:
questions.explanation_correct: Making pickles is a method of food preservation. Salt, oil, and spices prevent the growth of bacteria and fungi, keeping the food safe to eat for months or even years. Indian families have been making pickles for generations.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pickling is not just cooking or decoration. It is a traditional method of food preservation. The salt and oil create conditions where harmful bacteria cannot grow, allowing food to be stored for a long time.

questions.question_text: Drying food items like mango, fish, or chillies in the sun is a food preservation method because:

options.text: Removing moisture prevents the growth of germs

questions.explanation_correct: Drying food in the sun removes moisture (water). Without moisture, germs (bacteria and fungi) cannot grow, so the food stays safe for a longer time. Dried foods like aam papad, dried fish, and dry chillies last for months.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main purpose of drying is to remove water content. Bacteria and fungi need moisture to grow. By removing moisture, we prevent their growth and keep the food preserved for a long time.

questions.question_text: Anita's mother makes mango pickle with salt, oil, and spices during summer. The pickle lasts for the whole year. Which food preservation methods are being used here?

options.text: Adding salt (preservative) and oil to prevent air contact

questions.explanation_correct: In pickle-making, salt acts as a preservative by killing germs, and oil covers the food to prevent air and moisture from reaching it. Both these methods together help preserve the pickle for a long time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Traditional Indian pickles use salt and oil for preservation, not refrigeration or canning. Salt draws out moisture and kills germs, while oil creates a protective layer that keeps air and bacteria away.

questions.question_text: Why does milk spoil quickly if left outside the fridge in summer?

options.text: Because the sun makes it hot
Because warm temperatures help bacteria grow faster, which spoils the milk

questions.explanation_correct: In warm summer temperatures, bacteria grow and multiply very quickly in milk. These bacteria break down the milk, making it sour and spoiled. Refrigeration slows down bacterial growth, keeping milk fresh longer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main reason is bacteria. Warm temperatures are ideal for bacterial growth. Bacteria multiply rapidly in milk left at room temperature, especially in summer, causing it to turn sour and spoil.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a method of food preservation?

options.text: Leaving food uncovered in a warm place

questions.explanation_correct: Leaving food uncovered in a warm place is NOT a preservation method. It actually causes food to spoil faster because germs, flies, and warm temperatures all promote spoilage. Real preservation methods include refrigeration, drying, and adding salt or sugar.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Refrigeration, drying, and adding salt or sugar are all effective food preservation methods. Leaving food uncovered in a warm place does the opposite - it encourages bacterial growth and food spoilage.

questions.question_text: When should we always wash our hands?

options.text: Before eating and after using the toilet

questions.explanation_correct: We should always wash our hands before eating and after using the toilet. This prevents germs from entering our body through food. We should also wash hands after playing, touching animals, and sneezing or coughing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hand washing is not limited to specific activities or days. The most important times are before eating (to prevent germs from entering through food) and after using the toilet (to wash away germs).

questions.question_text: Why should we drink boiled or filtered water?

options.text: It kills or removes germs that can cause diseases

questions.explanation_correct: Boiling water kills the germs (bacteria, viruses) present in it, and filtration removes impurities and germs. Drinking contaminated water can cause diseases like cholera, typhoid, and diarrhoea.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The purpose of boiling or filtering water is to make it safe to drink by removing or killing germs. Unclean water carries harmful germs that can cause serious waterborne diseases.

questions.question_text: Washing fruits and vegetables before eating is not necessary.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Washing fruits and vegetables before eating is very important. They may have dirt, germs, and pesticide residues on their surface. Washing removes these harmful substances and makes the food safe to eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Fruits and vegetables must be washed properly before eating to remove dirt, germs, and chemical residues from pesticides. Not washing them can lead to illness.

questions.question_text: During the school lunch break, Ankit eats his food without washing his hands after playing cricket. What could happen?

options.text: Germs from his dirty hands may enter his body and make him sick

questions.explanation_correct: After playing, hands carry dirt and germs. If Ankit eats without washing his hands, these germs can enter his body through the food and cause stomach infections, diarrhoea, or other diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating with dirty hands is unhygienic. The germs on unwashed hands get transferred to food and then enter the body, which can cause stomach problems and various diseases.

questions.question_text: Kavya notices that the food kept uncovered on the dining table has flies sitting on it. Why is it unsafe to eat this food?

options.text: Flies carry germs on their legs and spread them to food
Flies change the colour of food

questions.explanation_correct: Flies carry germs on their bodies and legs. When they sit on food, they transfer these germs. Eating such contaminated food can cause diseases like cholera, dysentery, and diarrhoea. This is why food should always be kept covered.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main danger is that flies carry disease-causing germs. When flies land on food, they transfer these germs from garbage, drains, and dirty places. This contaminated food can make us very sick.

questions.question_text: Lakshmi is a vegetarian. Which food should she eat to get enough protein?
questions.explanation_correct: For vegetarians, excellent protein sources include dal (lentils), paneer, soybean, milk, curd, nuts, and rajma (kidney beans). These provide all the protein needed for growth and repair without eating meat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, sweets, and potatoes are mainly carbohydrates. Vegetarians can get plenty of protein from dal, paneer, soybean, milk, curd, and other plant-based protein sources.

questions.question_text: The deficiency of Vitamin C causes a disease called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by Vitamin C deficiency. Symptoms include bleeding gums, loose teeth, weakness, and slow wound healing. Vitamin C is found in citrus fruits like oranges, lemons, amla, and in guava and tomatoes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rickets is caused by Vitamin D deficiency, anaemia by iron deficiency, and goitre by iodine deficiency. Scurvy is the disease specifically caused by a lack of Vitamin C.

questions.question_text: Rice, wheat, and potato are rich in _____, which gives us energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Rice, wheat, and potato are rich in carbohydrates, which are the main energy-giving nutrients. They provide the fuel our body needs for daily activities like walking, running, studying, and playing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, wheat, and potato are not rich in proteins, fats, or vitamins. They are carbohydrate-rich foods that provide energy. Carbohydrates are the body's primary source of energy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following pairs of food and preservation method is CORRECT?

options.text: Mango pickle - adding salt and oil

questions.explanation_correct: Mango pickle preserved with salt and oil is the correct pair. Salt draws out moisture and kills germs, while oil prevents air contact. Fresh milk needs refrigeration, ice cream needs freezing, and bread is preserved by packaging, not adding water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk is not preserved by drying; it is refrigerated. Ice cream is not pickled; it is frozen. Bread is not preserved with water. Mango pickle with salt and oil is the correct food-preservation pair.

questions.question_text: A student's meal consists of: roti (wheat), rajma (kidney beans), palak sabzi (spinach curry), raita (curd), and guava. Identify the nutrients this meal provides.

options.text: Carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water

questions.explanation_correct: This meal provides all nutrients: roti (carbohydrates), rajma (proteins), palak (iron, vitamins, minerals), raita (protein, calcium, fats), and guava (Vitamin C, fibre). The curry would also have oil (fats). This is an excellent balanced meal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a well-planned Indian meal that provides all six nutrients from different food items. It is a great example of a balanced diet using common, affordable Indian foods.

questions.question_text: Which mineral is essential for strong bones and teeth?
questions.explanation_correct: Calcium is essential for strong bones and teeth. It is found in milk, curd, paneer, cheese, and green leafy vegetables. Children need calcium for growing strong bones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Iron is needed for blood, iodine for the thyroid gland, and sodium for nerve function. Calcium is the specific mineral needed for building and maintaining strong bones and teeth.

questions.question_text: Adding sugar to fruits (like in jam and murabba) helps preserve them for a longer time.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Sugar acts as a preservative. When added in large quantities (as in jam or murabba), sugar draws out moisture from the food and creates conditions where bacteria cannot grow, thus preserving the food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Sugar is a natural preservative. In jams and murabba (sweet pickles), high sugar concentration prevents bacterial growth by drawing out water, keeping the food safe for months.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important hygiene habit to prevent waterborne diseases?

options.text: Drinking clean, boiled, or filtered water

questions.explanation_correct: Drinking clean, boiled, or filtered water is the most important habit to prevent waterborne diseases like cholera, typhoid, and diarrhoea. Contaminated water is one of the biggest causes of disease in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While all hygiene habits are good, drinking clean water specifically prevents waterborne diseases. Contaminated water carries germs that cause cholera, typhoid, jaundice, and diarrhoea.

questions.question_text: Amit always avoids eating fruits and vegetables. His gums often bleed and wounds take a long time to heal. Which vitamin is he likely lacking?
questions.explanation_correct: Bleeding gums and slow wound healing are symptoms of Vitamin C deficiency (scurvy). Fruits (especially citrus fruits, amla, guava) and vegetables are the main sources of Vitamin C. Amit should include these in his diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin A deficiency causes eye problems, Vitamin B deficiency causes beriberi, and Vitamin D deficiency causes bone problems. Bleeding gums and slow healing are classic signs of Vitamin C deficiency.

questions.question_text: Which of the following foods is the richest source of Vitamin A?
questions.explanation_correct: Carrot is one of the richest sources of Vitamin A (in the form of beta-carotene). Other foods rich in Vitamin A include papaya, mango, sweet potato, spinach, and liver. Vitamin A is important for good eyesight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, wheat, and sugar are carbohydrate sources and do not contain significant Vitamin A. Carrots are famous for being rich in Vitamin A, which is why they are often recommended for good eyesight.

questions.question_text: A poor family in a village eats only rice for every meal because they cannot afford other foods. What advice would a health worker give them?

options.text: Add locally available, affordable foods like dal, green vegetables, and seasonal fruits for a balanced diet

questions.explanation_correct: The health worker would advise adding affordable local foods like dal (protein), green leafy vegetables (vitamins, iron), and seasonal fruits (vitamins) to the rice. A balanced diet does not need to be expensive - local, seasonal foods provide great nutrition.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The solution is not to eat more rice, stop rice, or eat less. The advice would be to add variety with affordable foods available locally, such as dal, seasonal vegetables, and fruits, to ensure the family gets all necessary nutrients.

questions.question_text: Drying, pickling, refrigeration, and canning are all methods of food _____.
questions.explanation_correct: These are all methods of food preservation. They help keep food safe to eat for a longer period by preventing the growth of germs that cause food spoilage.
questions.explanation_incorrect: These methods are not about cooking, decorating, or wasting food. They are methods of food preservation that slow down or prevent the growth of bacteria and fungi, keeping food fresh and safe.

questions.question_text: Water is not considered a nutrient because it has no calories.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Water IS considered a nutrient even though it has no calories. It is essential for all body processes including digestion, absorption, circulation, and temperature regulation. We cannot survive without water for more than a few days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Water is one of the six essential nutrients. Even without calories, water is vital for digestion, blood circulation, waste removal, and maintaining body temperature.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST set of hygiene practices?

options.text: Eat without washing hands, drink tap water, leave food uncovered
Wash hands before eating, drink clean water, keep food covered, wash fruits before eating
Eat roadside food daily, share someone else's glass
Skip bathing, do not brush teeth

questions.explanation_correct: The best hygiene practices include washing hands before eating, drinking clean water, keeping food covered, and washing fruits before eating. These prevent germs from entering the body and causing diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Options A, C, and D describe unhygienic practices that can lead to diseases. Option B lists all the correct hygiene practices that help keep us healthy and free from infections.

questions.question_text:
Assertion: We should use iodised salt in cooking.
Reason: Iodine prevents goitre.
Choose the correct option.

options.text: Both assertion and reason are true, and the reason explains the assertion
Both assertion and reason are true, but the reason does not explain the assertion
The assertion is true but the reason is false

questions.explanation_correct: Both statements are true and the reason explains the assertion. We should use iodised salt because it provides iodine, which prevents goitre (swelling of the thyroid gland). Iodine deficiency is common in many parts of India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The assertion (use iodised salt) is true and the reason (iodine prevents goitre) is also true. The reason explains why we should use iodised salt - to prevent iodine deficiency disorders like goitre.
